thread.title: IPS Amitabh Thakur, who complained against Mulayam, booked for alleged rape
thread.title_full: IPS Amitabh Thakur, who complained against Mulayam, booked for alleged rape - The Times of India

author: timesofindia.indiatimes.com
title: IPS Amitabh Thakur, who complained against Mulayam, booked for alleged rape
text:
LUCKNOW: Lucknow Police registered an FIR against Amitabh Thakur and his wife Nutan late on Saturday night.
The FIR was lodged on a complaint made by a Ghaziabad-based woman last year in which she had accused Thakur of raping her and his wife of helping him in the act, said station officer of Gomtinagar police station SM Abbas.
READ ALSO: Mulayam threatened me; he was upset about FIR against mining minister, Senior IPS officer Amitabh Thakur says
The complaint was made to then Lucknow SSP Yashyasvi Yadav but was not converted into an FIR till now.
Earlier, Amitabh Thakur, an inspector general of police, lodged a police complaint against SP boss Mulayam Singh Yadav for allegedly threatening him with dire consequences. In response, a senior UP police officer said there was no "prima facie" evidence of any criminality on the part of Mulayam.
A party leader had originally dismissed a two-minute audio clip of the purported conversation as "doctored", but spokesman CP Rai on Saturday evening told TOI, "Mulayam Singh is a very senior leader and has never known to have threatened anyone in this manner. Thakur has himself acknowledged Mulayam Singh Yadav is known to his family. It was unethical, therefore, for him to tape the conversation and make it public."
The Hazratganj police station accepted his complaint, which includes a transcript of the purported conversation, after the senior IPS office threatened to stage a sit-in. "His (Mulayam's) threat would amount to invoking of Section 506 of the IPC, which is a cognizable offence," Thakur has mentioned in his complaint. http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/followceleb.cms?alias=Nutan,Mulayam Singh Yadav,Mulayam,Lucknow police,FIR Stay updated on the go with Times of India News App. Click here to download it for your device.
